# SCNShadowMode.modulated

**Case**

SceneKit renders shadows by projecting the light’s [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNLight/gobo] image. The light does not illuminate the scene.

## Declaration

```swift
case modulated
```

## Discussion

Typically, you use this mode to create a low-accuracy, high-performance shadow under a game character or similar scene element: Use an image of a radial gradient (black to white) for the light’s [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNLight/gobo] property, and use [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNLight/categoryBitMask] properties to prevent the shadow image from appearing on the character.

## Constants

- **SCNShadowMode.forward**: SceneKit renders shadows during lighting computations.
- **SCNShadowMode.deferred**: SceneKit renders shadows in a postprocessing pass.
